arm_group.description: Subjects will take the multivitamin, and will also receive weekly Internet surveys asking them questions about the multivitamin treatment.
Subjects will take the multivitamin but will not receive surveys.

brief_summary.textblock:
Additional micronutrient supplementation is required due to the changes in the
      gastrointestinal anatomy and physiology following bariatric surgery along with decreased
      dietary intake and rapid weight loss. Good adherence to post-operative vitamins is essential
      to maintain healthy vitamin levels in the body following bariatric surgery. The hypothesis
      of this study is that patients receiving a weekly survey intervention will have better
      adherence to post-operative vitamins than a control group not receiving the survey.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Planning to undergo a Roux En Y Gastric Bypass or Sleeve Gastrectomy at Wake Forest
             Baptist Health

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Admission for a psychiatric event in the past year

          -  History of nausea and/or significant complaint of post-operative nausea

          -  History of stricture and/or significant complaint of post-operative stricture

          -  History of ulcer and/or significant complaint of post-operative ulcer

          -  History of major depression or psychiatric disorder

intervention.description: Subjects in this arm will receive weekly Internet surveys asking them how their treatment is working, how often they took the medication, and how easy it was to use the medication.

clinical_study.official_title: Adherence to Multivitamin Use Following Bariatric Surgery for Weight Loss

primary_outcome.description: Percent of anticipated number of doses the patient has taken, as recorded by a Medication Event Monitoring System (MEMS) cap.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
